title: To Kill a Mockingbird
description: Harper Lee’s Pulitzer Prize-winning classic explores racial injustice and moral growth in the Deep South through the eyes of young Scout Finch.
author: Harper Lee

title: Educated
description: Tara Westover’s memoir tells the story of a woman who grows up isolated in a strict and abusive household in rural Idaho and escapes to learn at Cambridge University.
author: Tara Westover

title: Atomic Habits
description: James Clear offers a proven framework for building good habits and breaking bad ones through small, consistent changes that yield remarkable results.
author: James Clear

title: The Hobbit
description: Bilbo Baggins sets out on an unexpected journey with Gandalf and a group of dwarves to reclaim treasure from the dragon Smaug.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

title: The Catcher in the Rye
description: J.D. Salinger’s classic novel follows Holden Caulfield, a disenchanted teenager navigating life and alienation in New York City.
author: J.D. Salinger

title: The Immortal Life of Henrietta Lacks
description: Rebecca Skloot tells the story of Henrietta Lacks, whose cells were taken without consent and became one of the most important tools in medicine.
author: Rebecca Skloot

title: The Da Vinci Code
description: Dan Brown’s fast-paced thriller follows symbologist Robert Langdon as he uncovers hidden clues within Leonardo da Vinci’s works to solve a murder.
author: Dan Brown

title: Becoming
description: Michelle Obama’s deeply personal memoir reflects on her journey from childhood in Chicago to becoming the First Lady of the United States.
author: Michelle Obama

title: Goodnight Moon
description: Margaret Wise Brown’s soothing bedtime story has lulled generations of children to sleep with its gentle rhythm and comforting illustrations.
author: Margaret Wise Brown

title: Why We Sleep
description: Neuroscientist Matthew Walker explores the critical role of sleep in our health, creativity, and longevity, backed by cutting-edge science.
author: Matthew Walker

description: George Orwell’s dystopian masterpiece imagines a totalitarian regime under Big Brother, exploring themes of surveillance and freedom.
author: George Orwell

title: The Alchemist
description: Paulo Coelho’s philosophical novel follows Santiago, a shepherd who embarks on a journey to find treasure and discovers his destiny.
author: Paulo Coelho

title: Thinking, Fast and Slow
description: Nobel laureate Daniel Kahneman explores the two systems that drive human thought — intuitive and deliberate reasoning.
author: Daniel Kahneman

title: Brief Answers to the Big Questions
description: Stephen Hawking’s final book offers his perspective on the biggest questions facing humanity, from AI to the future of our species.
author: Stephen Hawking

title: The Selfish Gene
description: Richard Dawkins revolutionized biology with the idea that genes, not individuals, drive evolution.
author: Richard Dawkins

title: The Wright Brothers
description: David McCullough chronicles the story of Wilbur and Orville Wright, the brothers who changed history by inventing the airplane.
author: David McCullough

title: Team of Rivals
description: Doris Kearns Goodwin’s study of Abraham Lincoln and his cabinet reveals leadership lessons from America’s most admired president.
author: Doris Kearns Goodwin

title: Steve Jobs
description: Walter Isaacson’s biography of Apple co-founder Steve Jobs offers an unflinching portrait of his creative genius and drive for perfection.
author: Walter Isaacson

title: Long Walk to Freedom
description: Nelson Mandela’s inspiring autobiography chronicles his life, struggle against apartheid, and 27 years of imprisonment.
author: Nelson Mandela

title: Matilda
description: Roald Dahl’s story of a brilliant young girl who loves reading and outsmarts her cruel headmistress, Miss Trunchbull.
author: Roald Dahl

title: The Name of the Wind
description: Patrick Rothfuss’s epic fantasy follows Kvothe, a gifted young man who grows into the most legendary figure of his world.
author: Patrick Rothfuss

title: Gone Girl
description: Gillian Flynn’s psychological thriller about a missing wife and a husband under suspicion keeps readers guessing until the end.
author: Gillian Flynn

title: Big Little Lies
description: Liane Moriarty weaves a story of secrets, friendship, and murder in a seemingly perfect Australian suburb.
author: Liane Moriarty

title: Me Before You
description: Jojo Moyes’s heart-wrenching love story between a caregiver and a paralyzed man explores life, loss, and love’s complexities.
author: Jojo Moyes

title: The Fault in Our Stars
description: John Green’s poignant novel about two teenagers with cancer who fall in love and confront the meaning of life and death.
author: John Green

title: The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People
description: Stephen R. Covey’s influential guide presents a principle-centered approach to personal and professional effectiveness.
author: Stephen R. Covey

title: You Are a Badass
description: Jen Sincero’s empowering book inspires readers to overcome self-doubt and live a more confident, successful life.
author: Jen Sincero
